fields.title: Types of Video Editing: A Guide
fields.content: Film editing translates raw footage into a directorâ€™s vision by taking individual shots and transforming them into a cohesive narrative. The postproduction process takes many forms, including linear and nonlinear editing, continuity and discontinuity editing, and editing techniques such as cuts and transitions.
fields.excerpt: Types of Video Editing: A Guide By Suzy Woltmann from BACKSTAGE
